00020 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00021 //      Exported Functions
00022 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00023 
00024 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00025 // Interrupt service routine (ISR) wrapper functions.
00026 // ISR handler can cause a context switch so MUST be declared "naked".
00027 // All ISR wrapper functions must perform following steps:
00028 // 1. Save the context of the interrupted task.
00029 // 2. Call the handler. This must be a separate function to ensure the 
00030 //    stack frame is correctly set up.
00031 // 3. Restore the context of whichever task will run next.
00032 //
00033 void ISR_Wrapper_USB    ( void ) __attribute__((naked));
00034 void ISR_Wrapper_Timer0 ( void ) __attribute__((naked));
00035 void ISR_Wrapper_FPGA   ( void ) __attribute__((naked));
00036 void ISR_Wrapper_VBus   ( void ) __attribute__((naked));
00037 
00038 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00039 
00040 void ISR_Wrapper_USB( void )
00041 {
00042     portSAVE_CONTEXT ();
00043 
00044     ISR_USB ();
00045 
00046     portRESTORE_CONTEXT ();
00047     }
00048 
00049 void ISR_Wrapper_Timer0( void )
00050 {
00051     portSAVE_CONTEXT ();
00052 
00053     ISR_Timer0 ();
00054 
00055     portRESTORE_CONTEXT ();
00056     }
00057 
00058 void ISR_Wrapper_FPGA( void )
00059 {
00060     portSAVE_CONTEXT ();
00061 
00062     ISR_FPGA ();
00063 
00064     portRESTORE_CONTEXT ();
00065     }
00066 
00067 void ISR_Wrapper_VBus( void )
00068 {
00069     portSAVE_CONTEXT ();
00070 
00071     ISR_VBus ();
00072 
00073     portRESTORE_CONTEXT ();
00074     }
